meanings.definition: The point on the earth's surface directly above the focus of an earthquake.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, the epicentre was the spot right above where it started.
meanings.sent2: Scientists quickly located the epicentre of the earthquake to study its effects.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was planned right on the epicentre of the park, causing chaos when it started raining.
meanings.sent4: In the game of tag, the epicentre was where the player with the ball stood, controlling the action.
meanings.sent5: The epicentre of the storm brought strong winds and heavy rain to the town.

meanings.definition: The central point of something, typically a difficult or unpleasant situation.
meanings.sent1: The epicentre of the problem was the misunderstanding between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: The epicentre of the storm caused widespread damage to the city.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the epicentre of laughter was when the clown slipped on a banana peel.
meanings.sent4: The epicentre of the debate was the controversial topic that divided the audience.
meanings.sent5: The epicentre of the movie was the emotional scene where the main character made a difficult decision.
